comments.body: Please stop saying “that’s a great idea.”
Bro, rival mention?
There could be mixed biomes support as well, along with custom biomes.
Good Idea!

they should do the new arch illager being called just so when you replay maps you aren't fighting someone who you already won against, but it kinda messes up the whole end dlc lore and stuff and the shards were meant to be destroyed so idk

I like this idea, it makes sense to have. I've always found Uniques to be pretty lack-luster especially once you get to Apocalypse Difficulty, having this would breathe some much-needed life into them and allow for better item synergy overall, good suggestion!
i feel like their special perk should be like "teir 4" because they are rarer than normal items, but that might be too op lol

we also need these changes:

1. make nether fortress a main mission unlocked by completing basalt deltas and warped forest, instead of being a secret in basalt deltas

2. increase the minimum difficulty of all nether missions except for nether wastes

3. complete remake of all nether level loot tables (they all have a pattern of 1 gear of every type(1 being nether exclusive)and 3 possible artifact rewards, they gain 1 more nether exclusive gear on adventure and a 5th non-nether exclusive gear or artifact on apocalypse)
YES PLS ADD

i really think this would be a cool mob, i really want more arthropod threats to the game, specially small swarmy ones, they would have to make it spawn in a specific way however to not mess up with huge redstone works players already made
What do you mean by quest?
I am surprised that there are not more people advocating for this!?!

Wow we really need more people to express their interest for quest support. Mojang and Microsoft would be stupid not to give legit support for vr. Personally, I think Mojang is working on native controller support and bug searching because of vr's higher variable count.
No thanks if they put any version on the quest it'd be bedrock. complete waste of time
I wonder if the reason why Microsoft has not created more VR versions of Minecraft is to avoid competition with the Hololens?

After playing Minecraft on the Gear VR, I am very disappointed that the Oculus Go and Oculus Quest do not have Minecraft through official means. I have installed the Gear VR to each the Go and the Quest via sideloading and it works great, so the effort to release Minecraft on the Go and Quest seems trivial. Please Mojang! Minecraft is the game that initially convinced me to even invest in VR! Minecraft VR is one of the best ways to experience both Minecraft and VR.

Would be great to see an official bedrock edition release to the quest
Sure would be quite popular
why has no one in the minecraft team suggest this it would make minecraft loads of money plus we get a good expericne
Yea. New quest and go owner would love minecraft on them........ please port soon.

@Blast Burner 

The Oculus quest is a new oculus product similar in concept to the oculus rift. 

https://www.oculus.com/quest/?locale=en_US
We need Minecraft on Quest and Go. Why the heck haven't they already realeased versions for both?
Great idea would love if it happened
The gear vr version works well if you side load it but being able to use the touch controllers would be the best
Already side loaded the Gear VR version and the code already supports 6DOF. :) That said, a fully supported native version, supporting native controls, would be really great!

This would be amazing if it was like the vive craft mod
Really hope this becomes a thing.
Blast Burner  Oculus Quest is a brand new all-in-one Virtual Reality console. It requries no PC or phone and has no wires so you can move around freely in the virtual world.

The Oculus Quest would be a great way to experience Minecraft and a port of the game to the system would make many sales because 1) Minecraft is awesome and 2) at this moment in time, there are not tons of games with lots of replayability factor, though there will be more coming up. So Minecraft would be able to capitalize on an open market essentially.
Oculus quest port PLEASE with full roomscale interaction! Thank you
I just wanna mine with my pickaxe in real life
We need this, please give the people what they want!

Yes would be great On Oculus Quest, the GearVr version works perfectly being sideloaded..

But the 6dof version kinda like the Rift but wireless would make it a perfect experience without wires
I'm honestly surprised this wasn't there at Quest launch.  If there's anything that could get me to buy Minecraft for the Xteenth time (okay, only like 5th or 6th) it's the Quest.
It would be absolutely amazing to see Minecraft come to the quest in it full glory!!!!! Please make this happen
I need this so badly!!
This to be a full 6dof touch-controller supported bedrock version if possible, not simply a copy of the gear VR version
I've already played it through sideloading. If there was an official version it would be a no-brainer. Make it easy for people to connect to Realms and download their worlds.
I want 6DoF like im used to on ViveCraft.

Quest + Minecraft would be the perfect match to further expand the minecraft user base and get new people into vr. It benefits everyone
So doooo it.
Would love to have this on the Quest!
If somehow this could be the Java version + Vivecraft mod, this will be awesome
I’d like to see Minecraft come to the Quest with room-scale support. I’d like for it to support tracking my hands so that when I swing my arm in real life, it swings my sword/pickaxe in game.
Would love this so much!! You could easily get a lot of money by making the port, tons of people would play, so it’d be worth it.
My Son and I would love a Minecraft port for Oculus Quest with full VR integration, but even a port of the Gear VR edition would make us happy.
Minecraft on the Oculus Quest would be such a great experience! Hopefully support is added, although there will be a few hoops to jump through...

Update: September 2019

Hello!

I have news from our team regarding Oculus Go/Quest:

While we have decided against a Java client for these platforms, we are still monitoring interest in a Bedrock version for these platforms.

This information has been added to our Previously Considered Suggestions list with the reason above.

We appreciate everyone's great input on this topic, and look forward to continuing the discussion on this topic. That said: 

Just a quick handy tip - if you're going to add a comment about "I agree" or "I disagree" to this post (and others) please feel free to elaborate on your position. The feedback site is not designed for petition posts (we can pretty much tell a lot of you agree because that's what the vote button is for), and the comment area should be used ONLY for discussion.

To be consistent with other "super popular posts", going forward, simple +1 and "I agree posts" (and similar) will continue to be removed. 

Thanks!
Everyone I know that bought a Quest has asked and is waiting for a clean port for the quest.

Yes please! I would absolutely love to see this on the quest. The version out now isn't as good. If you were to release the official version with the touch controllers i know i and many others would play for hours. It'd probably be one of the most if not most popular games on the quest. P.S: if you do release, i hope it's java edition :)
can it be java  please that would be so nice
I wholeheartedly agree. The untethered factor would be amazing along with the portability.

I want this really bad, it was one of the first games I looked for when I got the quest and was disappointed not to find it. I don't see why not it runs great on my phone so the quest should he able to handle it just fine.
Please lord give us minecraft!!!!!

I agree, but they should definitely take the route that Vivecraft went and not the official Oculus version. The Oculus version does absolutely nothing with the fact you're in VR. You cannot even use your left hand. Vivecraft however, has things like, the ability to use your left hand, mining blocks by punching them, swinging your weapon around to hit enemies, etc... while still being compatible with vanilla players. and because of this, it greatly improves the experience. But at least add the option to turn off smooth turning for rideable objects like boats.
Man I really hope this ends up happening I love playing the gear version sideloaded and would love to play it with hand presence

This'll be a great idea, I love Minecraft, and I want a simple way to play Minecraft vr, without having to find a desktop app, a mod for Minecraft, and find all that stuff, it'll be great for having it on the quest, and steamvr in general, but I hope they do it though minecraft.net and/or Microsoft do so people who already have the game (like me) don't have to pay twice for it

Minecraft would be perfect for the Quest! It'd be great for varying lengths of play sessions and would be an awesome demo to put people in. I'd love to explore around and create my dream home and actually wander around in it! Please make this happen!
I feel like I’m speaking for everyone here, we want this. There clearly is a market for this game on the quest, and I just can’t see how releasing this game could go wrong.

I think Minecraft would be perfect for the Oculus Quest, as it is not particularly demanding in terms of processing power, and has been shown to work well on other VR, and even mobile platforms. I have seen much of the user base express that they feel the same way. In addition, the tetherlessness of the Quest would significantly enhance the experience. I know Minecraft on the Oculus Quest would be an instant buy for me and many others.
I think this would jump to being one of the most purchased games on the Quest almost immediately.
I would really love to see a official minecraft release for the quest..  honestly i think Microsoft should get it out on all vr platforms.

I was surprised this wasn’t already on the quest when I got it, I really want it on there because many people only have a quest (such as myself) since their pc isn’t good enough, so they cannot have this Minecraft vr experience without it being on the quest. It’s also a different experience playing it on be then on a controller so that’s why I want it on the quest.

I would love to see this because it would be a great co op game. I've had multiple of my friends say the quest is cool but since there aren't that many co op games they aren't sure if they would want one. All of them have specifically said minecraft in vr would make them but the quest.

I would love to see this because it would be a great co op game. I've had multiple of my friends say the quest is cool but since there aren't that many co op games they aren't sure if they would want one. All of them have specifically said minecraft in vr would make them but the quest.

I agree because I really would love minecraft on the oculus quest as it would be better than just the side loaded way as you have the whole two controllers thing so overall I would just really love minecraft on the quest
Official Minecraft on the Quest would be EPIC!

I agree wholeheartedly. VR has always infatuated me, and I have been a minecraft fan for nearly half my life, and to see both of these things be able to correspond with one another is simply amazing. I love Minecraft VR but have never played it, instead I have seen nearly every single Minecraft VR video available to me. I remember first seeing the announcement for MC VR and I was completely ecstatic.

With the release of the Quest, and the many platforms which already have MC VR on it, I don’t see a reason to not add it on the Quest. The fan base is there, the tech is there, and a plus: it’s completely wireless, something which will undoubtably draw in more fans.

Please, if there is any possible way, add Minecraft Virtual Reality to the Oculus Quest. It has always been my dream to be able to experience such a thing. You would make many people happy.
I'd be willing to buy the game all over again just to get it on Quest!
Yes please - with touch support and NOT game pad. That would be awesome.

Quest port would honestly be one of the best things to happen to both mojang and oculus, and I would love to have full 6dof and oculus touch tracking, as that would make the experience more immersive and more enjoyable
I guarantee you most users who want minecraft aren't even on this subreddit, this would easily be a bestseller
Minecraft is perfect for the quest and the quest is perfect for Minecraft. It would be stupid not to port the game to the oculus quest. Now hurry up so I can buy my 6th copy of this game!

I think a native Quest port would be absolutely fantastic.  Something that supports the Touch controllers instead of requiring the additional pairing of an XBox controller.  This game would result in TONS of people never taking their headset off again.
If you are going to add it make sure it is FULL 6DOF! Minecraft in the oculus quest would be one of the best experiences on the device, and I really hope that it comes to the quest!

I would absolutely be willing to pay AAA console prices for a clean Minecraft port on the Oculus store. I'm not an expert with side-loading and would love to be able to play my favorite game with my little brother while I'm traveling on the road.
Can’t wait to play this game on my oculus quest.

I think that Minecraft definitely should be added to the quest. Minecraft is an incredibly fun game, you can build anything, make incredible things, or just have fun. It also has incredible replay ability, you can make an infinite number of houses, things, etc. but it has always been tethered to a console, laptop, pc, or be headset that requires a pc and is expensive, with cords. I believe if Minecraft was added to quest, it would be amazing. Being able to experience it even more, in different ways like be, and anywhere with the quest, without cords! That would be absolutely amazing. I’m sure it would sell a lot too. I would recommend being able to go back to older versions on it though, just Incase some version has an error, or if people prefer an older version maybe. It would be the best thing to happen to the quest, because currently there isn’t really any games you can put a lot of time into that people are familiar with
It would need 6dof with the quest controllers, but absolutely
We need this. Now.
I'd love to see my bedrock worlds in the world of vr!

Bring Minecraft to the Oculus Quest! Being wireless is a game changer and Minecraft could be one of the most immersive experiences on the headset yet! Make sure to support the touch controllers though and not make us have to connect a x box controller.

I would love to see Minecraft ported to the quest.

I would love the option to shoot arrows with motion controls and to actually swing a sword or tool.
Regular button controls would need to be supported too because not everyone would want to use gestures all the time.

It would be really cool to do something different with the menus. I would like to physically interact with my inventory instead of just moving a cursor around. 

Minecraft ported straight over would be cool, but adding support for VR specific gameplay elements would be next level.
I would absolutely love a Quest version of Minecraft with 6DoF that also allows me to be able to chop trees with my own two hands! Talk about the future right there.
Room scale and Quest controller support, please!

Absolutely, on the Oculus Quest. Half the reason I GOT a Quest is because I thought Minecraft would be a launch title. I also assumed it would be the Java edition somehow, and therefore receptive to modding.  

Being wrong *twice* was disheartening...
Minecraft VR looks fun from the footage i've seen. Just as long as it has 6dof and the hands follow the controllers it would be great.
I would love to see this on the Oculus Quest; I just hope that mods will work, along with true 6DoF movement and interactions! :-D
Every Quest owner would immediately be a Minecraft user. Unless there's a huge obstacle nobody is seeing, this is a slam dunk.
Thanks for creating a separate count for the quest. I loved the Oculus rift version and would love to play some version of that on the quest. Thanks for the chance to make our voices heard!

FRIGGIN JESUS WE NEED THIS! While I still had my vive I played vivecraft and it was SO SO SO SO SO fun and I really want that for my oculus quest. And PLEASE make it the same as it was for vivecraft (having arms and whatnot) and not just a Minecraft you need a controller for that just happens to be in vr.
It needs to be on quest!! If it's already on rift whats the problem putting it on quest?
Minecraft in vr is amazing! The Quest needs this so badly! Like Shia said JUST DO IT!
Would be a lovey edition to Minecraft family of platforms.

I would love to see a unique approach to VR if a Quest version is ever available. 

Like swinging my arms with a diamond pickaxe and breaking all the stones in one swing. or hitting the obsidian 10 times to break it. It'd be nice to be able to switch arms. one arm could get tired really fast. or double swing two diamond pickaxes? that'd be great!!!

I am completely down for this! Trying to stream it from my PC (java edition with mods) can get tedious at times, but still fun. If it was native to the Quest, I'd be down for either a limited time discount for those who already own Minecraft (like with the release of Bedrock for PC) or buy the game again if I had to.

I will say that I'd be mildly disappointed if it wasn't compatible with the Java release, but understanding why that was the case. To be honest, it would probably make me play the Bedrock edition more because of it.

Also if this does get pushed through, can we have cross platform sync? I assume it'll be put on it like for PC and Mobile versions, but I just want to put that out there. I would like to use the same skin for the account.

Edit: I wasn't aware (somehow) that Minecraft was already ported to Gear Vr. Some additional requests: Please let us use full roomscale interaction and have compatibility with the Oculus Touch controlers (similar to how Vivecraft has implemented their experience)
Come on!
I agree , it will make a beloved game more accessible
Has to include 6dof and roomscale tracking!
Minecraft fits perfectly into the Quest's performance profile.  It's a no-brainer.  And, it's important that mods be supported.

There's no way this wouldn't top the charts on the quest store. This could outsell beat Saber if that's even possible. Quest users are starving for a long game to lose themselves in. This is a no brainer.
I think the potential for using a field to play around in minecraft could be insane. Plus a scalable view would be cool too
This would be a smart idea and I’m surprised there isn’t more demand, maybe bring on the vive craft team to help with the development

I think this is a good idea because it would be the first decent minecraft experience that’s complete untethered, and you can also be very immersed as it is vr instead of on a phone or nintendo switch, etc
As a Minecraft veteran that's been playing since Alpha I would love nothing more than to experience it on the Oculus Quest!
May even convince me to finally try out Minecraft

I have purchased Minecraft 5 times now. I would love to be able to see it in quest without jumping through a ton of hoops to approximate it with the Gear VR version. I feel there is already a version that exists that is nearly there. Please finish the port so I can buy it again.
Can we have full vr support kinda like vivecraft where we can connect to java servers and if someone has it installed they will see the hand movements (PLEASE NOT BEDROCK EDITION)
This would be soo good in the Quest! I would get it straight away!
This is the game I've been waiting for on the Oculus Quest! A must buy title.
I absolutley love playing vivecraft on my pc, Minecraft on the quest would be VERY EPIC

I think this would be a very good idea because without wires you could really feel immersed in the Minecraft world and create, survive and explore with the full 6 degrees of freedom and high resolution screen! Seeing how Minecraft is not that performance demanding it would work amazingly with the Oculus Quest! I hope this great idea becomes reality soon!
Ever since I saw a youtube video I've craved soaring over the blocky landscape in VR. Please make it happen! It would finaly be like I was inside the video games of my youth!
Around 1 million Quest headsets have sold in a couple months. It's a wise decision to bring this to Quest, which will soon be one of the most popular VR headsets.
Minecraft is by far my favorite gaming experience in my 30 years of gaming. I'd like to recommend a robust multiplayer system. That way my whole family could play at the same time.

I couldn't agree more as to getting this on the oculus quest. No wires on the quest provides a lot of free movement which would be required in Minecraft. I really hope this post gets noticed as it is something I would love and many many of my friends would too!

I would rebuy for the Quest in a heartbeat. I'd also be much more inclined to get into the multiplayer experience on Quest vs. PC. I have the game on PC and am using Vivecraft with my HTC Vive but I would love the simplicity and wireless freedom of the Quest. It's also the perfect device to bring to work and when visiting friends and family, and minecraft is such a great way to show off the infinite possibilities of VR. I'm sure you will bring it to the Quest eventually and I'm definitely looking forward to it!
I think that Minecraft would be great on the Quest. It would be easy to get into because there aren’t any wires. It would be really immersive.

Owner of Oculus Quest here, having a proper version of Minecraft would be awesome. Right now many people are just sideloading the GearVR version which is still cool but is definitely not the "proper" way to play it on such an awesome platform like the Quest, especially because there is no Touch implementation. Would be a killer app
The most popular game alongside the best, most accessible 6DOF headset? It's a dream come true and a great way to advance VR!

Being able to play minecraft on wireless VR with 6dof and touch controllers would be a game changer. It has been proven that minecraft gear vr can run smoothly on the quest with up to 25 chunks, so why not make some graphical and gameplay improvements and release a Bedrock version made for the Quest?
Yes! I want to be able to use my oculus controllers and swing that pick axe!

Its diabolical that GearVR has a version and it never came to Oculus Go at the very least! Now there couldn't be a better suited device than the Oculus Quest to play Minecraft! Portable Standalone VR, I'm sure it would be dangerously addictive for many many people that love Minecraft, the ease and convenience of it being pick up and play would be a dream. I'd also imagine once people have had a taste of the game in VR on quest it would sell very well!

currently i play MC using vivecraft , and then steam it using amd relive vr app to my oculus quest
and all peoples who try it love it
if we got oficial version of MC similar to vivecraft  i will spend 60 eu for it, we need it for sure 
but it it by like oculus go, well better not, minecraft need hand traking and stuff
The freedom offered by wireless VR is amazing, and I can think of no other game I want more on the Quest than Minecraft
Mine craft is amazing in vr, having played it on rift. Playing without wires would just be on another lever !!!

I agree that it should be ported to the Quest. I just bought my Oculus Quest last Monday, and i'm absolutely in love with it. I didn't want to have to put a ton of money into getting a VR ready PC/Laptop and have the hassle of all the cords, so this is a wonderful compromise. And for someone like me (who has never tried VR before), being so immersed into it for the first time is something special. I was hoping there would be Minecraft on the Quest already, but sadly I came to the reality that there wasn't. I have been a huge fan of Minecraft ever since it first released, and played it ever since. To actually be "inside" a virtual reality Minecraft world, and have to use your arms and everything to fight, mine, craft, ect. would be something out of this world. I've only seen videos of people playing it, and I can tell you that i'm already on-board with the idea. I truly hope that Minecraft is playable 100% on the Quest in the near future. We can only hope.

 

-MN Riley

Both Oculus and Microsoft will make alot of money if you release minecraft on the quest and maybe rift. And also make tons of money if there was a oculus quest minecraft bundle with the game and themed headset and controllers.

I agree.minecraft absence in the quest is what gives me second thoughts about buying the oculus quest. Im sure if minecraft gets released officially for the quest my wallet will walk itself to best buy and purchase both the headset and game for me.
Yes please
Pls bring it to the quest, I really want to play in VR

PLEASE DO THIS. I would love to be able to play with my friends who don't own powerful enough PCs to run VR. On top of that, think about the money you could make by porting one of the most popular games released in the past 10 years to a system that's already been sold out everywhere. Trust me this would be a worthwhile investment.

I'm surprised this wasn't on Quest week one or even just teased, the monetary value for Microsoft is through the roof with the popularity of the quest combined with the popularity of Minecraft. Though, I would prefer a more VR centric focus instead of a port utilising the touch controllers as a motion tracked gamepad. Something like Vivecraft where you can actually punch the blocks and pull the bows back, just the little details.

As someone who was (and still is) miffed to find out that Minecraft PE will not work with Google Cardboard (w/wireless controller, natch) and someone who just received his Oculus Quest today: YES, PLEASE!!

I think it would be great if they did port it over officially. I have played both the sideloaded gear vr version on Quest and I have played the vivecraft mod on the HTC Vive. If I wanted one or the other to be ported I would want to have the HTC vive craft controls rooted over because the immersion is great! You can actually hold your pickaxe and mine blocks instead of using a game pad and clicking a trigger. Feel more immersed when your fighting a zombie with your sword or eating when you actually put the food to your mouth. If you haven’t seen gameplay of the vivecraft mod I highly recommend you check it out it’s a great time and I’m hoping it gets ported!
I'm surprised that you need to vote for this ... VR is the future, man! Make Minecraft for all VR platforms please!

Already I have been asked about Quest Minecraft when showing friends. I'd say about 75% of my 'gamer' friends ask. Having Minecraft on the Quest would bring the most popular game ever to one of the most burgeoning industries, not to mention one of the most ambitious mediums. To top this off, the Quest is also the most accessible 6DoF headset.

 

It just makes sense.
I feel like a full 6dof hand presence Minecraft on the go would be amazing! I already play Minecraft on my rift but I’m hardly home, if it came to the quest i would be able to play it a lot more
Please make it happen!!! This would be a no brainier for my friends to buy the quest!
If they do it, it should be java edition please for the love of god

This would be amazing. Plain and simple the quest is the most convenient and enjoyable bet device on the market. Minecraft is a very relaxing and enjoyable game and it would be amazing to be able to play it on the quest. Also, specs can’t be a problem. Minecraft is a very low spec game and it would run great.

As a Minecraft Mentor for Education, I REALLY hope this comes to Quest so the Education Team can also port their version. We have a Quest here at our school and use Minecraft Education pretty regularly. Would really blow our students' minds to be able to walk around in their own creations.
I agree! Minecraft is a classic game that I’d absolutely LOVE playing in vr! Especially without any wires holding me back!

i agree with this post 100%

i would love to play a VR Minecraft and i don't ever see a PS VR Minecraft happening 

i would love the controls to be like minecraft java's "vivecraft" mod
I would love to have this on my Quest. I sideloaded the GearVR version and it's amazing, but I would LOVE to be able to use the Oculud Touch controllers. We need this. I would easily pay $30+ :)

This is perfect! Oculus desperetly needs to add a game like minecraft to it's store as it lacks a game players can sink hundreds of hours in. Minecraft also desperetly needs VR as it has become stale. The new updates bring more playability and more possibility but it's still the same old game under all of the shiny new stuff added. VR brings new life to a game and makes it feel exciting and more immersiv which is just what Minecraft needs. Bith companies stand to gain from this.

Well they wanted Minecraft to be cross platform so this should be a no brainer! I have a few friends considering buying Oculus quests to play Minecraft with me the on the rift. It was on the Gear Vr so the quest should run it with ease!

Yes because there is huge opportunity with virtual reality. As virtual reality devices continue to be reduced in price, the demand for them will theoretically grow. Because Minecraft is such a well-known game, it would be easily bought and used among the masses new to VR. The Oculus Quest is a relatively cheaper version of VR compared to the Rift and Vive. It would be a missed opportunity if it were not to go onto the Quest. I would recommend investing a game in the Oculus Quest and PSVR.
This would be amazing. It would bring opportunities to my children to enjoy VR also. Not only that, it brings a new player base to both the game and the platform. This really should happen
I'd buy a Quest version that allows you to play with touch controllers.

It would be much more beneficial for both parties, Microsoft and players, to add Minecraft to the oculus quest. Most players who want to play Minecraft on the quest can already do so buy sideloading the apk or streaming through alvr. This is bad for both the players and Microsoft because the controls aren’t optimized and the whole overall experience is worse and Microsoft doesn’t get money for a purchase. If they did support it it would not be difficult at all as it is already supported on the gear vr meaning for little effort they could make more money and we can have a better experience!
I absolutely agree, my son would die. We have it on rift, so this would be an amazing thing. Please make this, regardless of how many people actually take the time to vote!

This would be great. Combined with DLC that is shared within a family this is the next big thing for Minecraft. 

We would all get VR glasses (Oculus Quest) and meet in a real 6Dof Minecraft world. 

Making use of the controllers of the Quest would add more reality than ever. Although for Oculus Go users there could be a simpler interaction way or/and use a controller.

 Ojang/MS please give us A update on what the plans are for this and if there is a timeframe for dev/release.

 

Thanks
I need this on mobile vr and the gear vr is terrible compared to go or quest.
Crossplay would be amazing too
This would instantly be the best game on the platform.

I totally agree, entering the world of Minecraft in VR, you've known and loved for such a long time really has a unique magical feel to it and would definitely sell very well on the Quest (with a normal price), as it is so highly accessible.
Please! I want it! It's the one reason why I bought Oculus Quest! Don't make me sad(
I (only) agree if there is controller tracking, i don’t want to use an xbox controller!
I agree, Quest users should be able to have fun with this, being free in the Minecraft World would be awesome, and at no graphical issue because of how simple the game is.
As soon as I bought the Oculus Quest I was excited about the Minecraft potential!

Having such a great game to come to Oculus Quest would open Minecraft VR to people who don't want to buy a whole room-scale VR headset, the Quest could be a great opportunity to show Minecraft to people who just got the Quest instead of a PC or Phone! And since it's so easy to share, it could be great for showing friends! I would say, this would be a great thing! And look, Minecraft can run on basically anything! The Quest's hardware doesn't seem like a limitation for Minecraft.

One of the things that got me into VR was watching others play VR Minecraft. I loove my Quest but if Minecraft was added I would be ten times happier. Please! If the Gear VR can support Minecraft, the Oculus Quest can too.
Just got the oculus quest July 9th would love to c Minecraft on it

I would love this! I wanted to get Minecraft on VR but having a Mac rules out all of the other options. I was pretty disappointed to see that it was not possible. I just recently recieved my Oculus Quest, and it baffles me that there's not a single official way of playing Minecraft on it. To me, it seems quite obvious to include.

This platform is rapidly growing. Any quality game (such as Minecraft) or well known game (such as Minecraft) would certainly bring seasoned players back in as well as new ones.

One of the very frequent first questions that comes up is “How do I get Minecraft on Oculus Quest?”. The community needs a way of being fully immersed in their favourite game that doesn’t involve sideloading, magically connecting to steam, and somehow streaming vivecraft from a PC. This does work, but it’s downright annoying. An official title that is entirely local on the device would be far better in the render quality and in the overall quality of the game.

Minecraft is such a fantastic game and it’s a shame that it is limited to computers, consoles, and phones. VR is the future of gaming. Please be a part of that future!

I've been playing minecraft for years. I first played it on the xbox 360. It was an amazing experience. I remember playing it at night with a friend. He was telling me to build shelter because it was getting dark. But I ignored him not thinking anything of it. Suddenly a creeper appeared in front of me and exploded. I was terrified. I didn't want to keep playing because of how bad it spooked me. I asked him if I could borrow his console, and I was able to play the game more and understand it better. Later on down the road another friend of mine got minecraft for 360 as well. Every time I went to his house, we'd play for hours. Building rollar coasters, creating a giant mansion, eventually making a nether portal and having mobs sneak into our house from there. His brother ended up deleting our world though because he raged, hard. One day I heard about pocket edition being released. I was elated! I only had an ipod touch 4G at the time, but if I could tell you what the battery was used on the most, it was that. Fast forward a few years, and I got a laptop. There I was able to play Minecraft on the PC! It was the best experience ever! Getting to play on servers ONLINE! With all different kinds of unique plugins, and mods. I remember it taking me a while to figure out how to type in game, but I eventually got the hang of it. Not too long after, a player offered to let me create a room in his mansion because I was a complete novice. I was really thankful. I've made so many memories on Minecraft. I haven't been able to play at all on my PC now since all the updates the game has gotten. My laptop only has 2GB of ram, so I was able to enjoy it down to the end. I haven't' been able to play by myself on my PC for over 4 years now. I miss it a lot. I got an oculus quest: because of the lack of my PC not working, I have dreamed of playing minecraft in VR for years since the first time I saw a video on youtube. Please. You guys have been able to create the minecraft experience into so many new consoles. Even the switch and nintendo ds! 

Please create it on the Oculus Quest as well. So I can continue making new memories with my friends.

-Sincerely Matt

I really think this is a good idea.

I agree with Microsoft's decision against a Java client, as that would be expected because of the Quest's low specs, but also because the Quest is a mobile device. The Oculus Quest is literally just a phone in a vr headset plus some fancy sensors. Most importantly, you can take the Oculus Quest almost anywhere you would find practical enough to play Minecraft. For example, my friends and I had lots of fun playing ViveCraft (a PC version of java minecraft that is vr) over virtual desktop, but the latency and the lag made the experience a little disappointing. Bedrock version on Oculus Quest would be phenomenal. After all, all Bedrock versions have controller support. 

An important part of making Bedrock edition amazing on the Oculus Quest would be compatability with other Quests and even other devices (like how the Switch can play with Xbox, PC, and Mobile). I understand that this might already be one of the requirements, but I don't just mean cross-compatibility as in only being able to play with other devices, but also being able to, for example, see where the hands and head are on the Quest. If the Quest user waves, you should be able to see that motion on the other devices.

Playing Minecraft on any VR system is considerably difficult. Not only is moving awkward, but along with that, swinging to hit or mine is really slow and difficult. There should be some sort of optimization for VR.

6DOF IS ESSENTIAL! Without 6dof, minecraft VR wouldn't be immersive enough to make users pay another $7 or so dollars on. 

I hope reading this message may help you, or if it doesn't, I hope it sets some new expectations for the community. Thank you for your time.

Furthermore, it hardly seems worth the effort of attempting to allow crossplay between Bedrock and Java, and I specifically request that Mojang not allocate resources toward that effort.

The reason that Minecraft Java and Minecraft Bedrock Edition cannot 'talk to' each other at the moment is because Bedrock is written in C#, rather than Java as this runs much faster and is better suited for mobile devices than Java.

Because the two programs are written in different languages, the main engines of the two work very differently. For example:

  • In Java, the dirt block might have the id of 32, but in bedrock, it might be 64.
  • Bedrock's worlds are saved and read in a different way to Java, meaning that if a server were to broadcast a world to both Java and Bedrock, it would have to be able to send the world data off in two very different formats and be constantly converting data between the two. This would be very costly towards the server

There is still hope that the two versions will be able to cross one day, but due to the changes that would need to take place to both versions, this is not anytime soon.

Also, as mentioned in another comment, making Bedrock available for MacOS and/or Linux would take developers off of Java, the original (and in my eyes better) platform.

"Better Together" can only be realized by bringing Bedrock to the Mac (sorry Java fans, but cross-platform Java will likely not be happening, although it is a great idea). Given that Bedrock is written in C++, which is by its nature portable, there really is no technical reason why a port to Mac can't be done.

So bring Bedrock to the Mac, have it co-exist with Java for a couple of years as players decide which version to go with (hint: they will switch to Bedrock so they can play with everyone else). Then give Java modders a real way to port their mods to Bedrock (not trivial but worth doing).

Okay.

First of all, the java edition should NOT, I repeat, NOT be abandoned, as it is written in Java, which makes the game much easier to mod.

Second, cross platform is not possible, or even plausible, between the Java version of Minecraft, and the Bedrock (C++) version of Minecraft. They use different programming languages, and have numerous differences in rendering engines, performance, availibility on ARM architechure processors, and so much more.

Third, for all of y'all out there who think "Minecraft Bedrock Edition is only for Android, iOS, and Windows 10," I say this: Android and iOS both only run on ARM architechure processors, while Windows 10 is not made for ARM. Mac OS and Linux are both (mostly, in the case of linux,) not made for ARM. The technical hurdle of ARM and non ARM has been overcome. It is possible to run Windows 10 on both a Mac, and a Linux machine (by this I mean a machine that was made specifically to run Mac OS or a Linux distro.) So processor type is not the issue.

What about the program itself? The Minecraft for non ARM is an exe file, how will that work on a Mac?

Well, Mojang will have to figure that out... At least they would, if they had not made Education Edition work on Mac OS.

So there you have it. My opinion mixed with my experience (from trying to get Java Edition to work on an ARM based Chromebook... It didn't work.)

Hope I have helped clear things up, and I sincerely hope that Mojang ports Bedrock Edition at least to Linux.

I 95% agree with this post, Bedrock should 100% come to macOS but definitely not at the expense of the Java edition.  And as much as I would love to have Bedrock-Java crossplay, I alas know that while the Java edition is still coded in Java and Bedrock remains in C++, it will most likely not possible.

There is some hope though, the pocket edition of Minecraft on the iPhone is bedrock and is able to run on iOS, as macOS continues to be more and more like iOS and iPadOS there should be reason to believe it possible especially with the macOS 11 Big Sur coming this October 2020. If Minecraft: Bedrock Edition does come to the mac then it will most likely be available for purchase in the app store, just like how Minecraft bedrock on Windows 10 is available in the Microsoft store for purchase. Java will always be available on the web for all computer operating systems, but as time moves on we will slowly move away from Java Edition and only have one universal Minecraft for all consoles, computer, and mobile devices. Although you can't play Bedrock on Mac and Linux, there are still some options. For Mac users you can download the android emulator app called BlueStacks and purchase Minecraft or run Windows 10 in bootcamp if you have space on your disk. For Linux users you can start a Windows 10 virtualbox and purchase Minecraft.

If you don't like these options then you could always stick to Java Edition!

With the announcement of Project Catalyst which provides numerous tools to allow iOS-built apps to be easily recompiled to run on macOS, I think this availability request is worth talking about again. Now's the perfect time to look into porting the Bedrock engine to macOS, which is becoming more and more like iOS, and iOS already supports the game. Additionally, after Apple transitions all their notebook and desktop products to their own Silicon chips, there will be no excuse for not having a port; those chips literally run iOS apps natively! If the concern is over Microsoft wanting exclusive ownership, well, that just doesn't make sense. There's a whole market out there asking for a macOS port, and with the tools mentioned above, a port should be far from difficult. Hell, there was a version available for Apple's TV for some time, but not macOS? The Education Edition is available for Mac and runs on the Bedrock engine, but the base game isn't available? It just doesn't make sense.

I support having the Bedrock Edition on the mac, but I think I have forged a theory as to why this is not the case. Minecraft Education edition uses the Bedrock engine, but it is still available on the mac. This means that Mojang has already made the engine compatible with the mac, so it makes sense that the only reason why Minecraft Bedrock isn't available is that Mojang doesn't want to. Mojang is owned by Microsoft and is in Competition with Apple so it makes perfect sense why this is the case. Now one way this theory could be debunked so far is "Minecraft java is on the mac", but Minecraft Java was made available on the Mac before Microsoft bought Mojang and the only reason why they didn't shut it down on the Mac as it would be so controversial and wouldn't be popular with the community. They shut down the old console editions only because barely anyone played them, but that just wasn't the case with the Mac.

Raytracing can also be brought to Linux, at least, via Vulkan and performance can be increased with AMD FidelityFX Super Resolution to help make this feasible, performance wise, since it's compatible with all graphics cards and AMD integrated GPUs / APUs.

Now is a great time to do so.

While there is certainly a business element to their refusal, we'll just mention what seems to be the most practical way to implement this on both platforms:

OSX: we don't know enough to say for sure, but if IOS uses the same Metal API for graphics as OSX, it should be almost trivial to port over.

GNU/Linux: If the Android version is tweaked to use the common subset of Bionic and glibc, both platforms should work on nearly identical codebases. If Microsoft is truly as supportive of OSS as they claim, they should prove it by implementing the known set of patches used in the community launchers to adapt their Android release into an almost 0 maintenance Android and GNU/Linux port.

Also:

I have news from our team regarding Oculus Go/Quest:

While we have decided against a Java client for these platforms, we are still monitoring interest in a Bedrock version for these platforms.

This information has been added to our Previously Considered Suggestions list with the reason above.

We appreciate everyone's great input on this topic, and look forward to continuing the discussion on this topic. That said: 

Just a quick handy tip - if you're going to add a comment about "I agree" or "I disagree" to this post (and others) please feel free to elaborate on your position. The feedback site is not designed for petition posts (we can pretty much tell a lot of you agree because that's what the vote button is for), and the comment area should be used ONLY for discussion.

To be consistent with other "super popular posts", going forward, simple +1 and "I agree posts" (and similar) will continue to be removed. 

Thanks!

Please, PLEASE, PLEEAAASE consider what can be done to release a launcher on Steam as Microsoft has done for numerous titles. I don't know how much influence the developers or the individual reading this actually have, but this is probably the best opportunity I'll have to beg someone to solve my petty gamer problem. It already feels like a hassle to play Minecraft (especially via the god-forsaken Xbox app), let alone on Steam Deck which demands any of a few complicated methods just to get one of the least resource-demanding games of the 2010s running. I can lazily install a third-party launcher that magically runs damn near the entirety of my Epic library with no issue, I can easily install Battle.net and run everything I own there, and I can quickly tap into Xcloud by following Microsoft's tutorial; but Minecraft, which seems to me the ideal game to play on such a configurable portable device, feels like too great an ask of time and hoop-jumping to even bother. I actually did do it once, and after some slightly frustrating control-mapping it worked well, but when the time came to factory reset the Deck for a regular "cleaning" it didn't feel worth it to bother doing all that again. To be clear, my interest in playing Minecraft on the Deck hasn't at all diminished, I just wish it wasn't one of the most obnoxious games in my purview to install on it. Steam Deck very literally enabled me to play more games more often, and I still kinda wish Minecraft was one of those games.

I personally don't ask for legacy edition returning and being brought up to par with modern editions, except possibly the xbox one and ps4 editions getting new blocks, but having what was lost from the older games brought into the new game would be a game changer. The externally run servers like hive and mineplex are fun to join, but having the official Minecraft hunger games, spleef, and elytra games you could customize, setup, and chat with people in, all the while doing the easter eggs in the lobby and having it be easy to invite your friends to a game conveniently would be great, even using the old maps, because there's a reason people still play legacy pvp when they can get bedrock free. Also being able to have an actual tutorial or tutorial prompts would help the kids to be on par with more educated players, I loved getting to walk around and thoroughly explore each hand crafted map an update and seeing the entirely new map to teach the player how to do certain thing. I know bedrocks basic prompts have glitches, but I could see it working to help narrow the gap, just make it count as a cheat world like the old game so the kids will open portals in their own worlds to complete the achievements. Having worlds where like in the old game 1 of a necessary structure would usually appear in world generation unlike the current "old" style world generation, it's more similar to cave-game or Minecraft beta than Minecraft legacy worlds (jk). But just wish they were in the game.

The old world generation would run better in general, be better suited for non realm 8 player exploration together, actually function as a completely playable map rather than crappy "old" world generation, and be better modable than an infinite world having less chunks loaded in.

It has a much more stable game engine and it generally has remained that way through every large update to date. I understand that developing for older consoles would likely be impossible because some consoles don't even support pushing game patches anymore, but they should enable the Editions button for all supportable platforms, and work on Editions once more. This is highly infeasible. Aside from the fact that any censoring technology is probably going to _teach_ your children fun new words by bleeping out such innocent phrases as "basement," the game is in 3D. You'd need something quite computationally intense to search not just blocks in a plane, but on any diagonal or even far into the distance. I could see someone putting blocks tens of hundreds of meters apart, but set up so it spells a bad word facing spawn.

I doubt this can be fixed without completely ruining the experience, and I'll also add that perhaps the problem is not the _game,_ but the community on those server(s).Technology can't, and shouldn't, solve all problems.

Get together with a group of friends and build your own server (it's educational, and not really that hard!) or go buy yourself a Realm (or just run on the LAN if that's all your kids care about). You could make it private to only some well-behaved kids in the local neighborhood and perhaps some interested parents.

I can actually understand why this is an issue being as minecraft is a game targeted towards kids. And honestly you shouldn't be cursing or posting inappropriate content on an E for everyone server. At the same time this is the internet and you should educate your daughter on the subject.

With that being said along with ways to report users perhaps on certain servers we can add certain commands like censoring out or preventing the use of curse words. There are also lots of servers out there that are designed to be kid friendly.

With respect to the person two comments above me, it is not reasonable to expect the owner(s) of a very busy, public server that operates for everyone's enjoyment on a free-for-all basis to investigate and instantly respond to something as minor as someone building a "corncob."

Said owner will be incredibly busy keeping the server secure and operational, preventing actual griefing, keeping infrastructure operational (both in and out of game), and probably maintaining in-house plugins. They don't have time to pop in and confirm that someone built an inappropriate structure, and on top of that, after all the things they've probably seen that are worse, will probably consider it funny or not a cause for concern. However, automating this would only lead to abuse.

Also, flat banning someone on the first apparent offense is quite harsh no matter what.

In general, I would not expect a local server owned by the person down the block to handle this sort of thing, much less one visited by hundreds or thousands of people. Treat it like you would visting 4chan or something, where you can expect rude people.

I do see how a player report system would work, however do beware that it is often servers for 18+ players. Most 'family-friendly' servers like Hypixel or Cubecraft have rules against these, but it is unlikely that an account would be terminated due to what they did on a server.

There is a reason why the ESRB places a small notification on all of their content ratings: "Game experience may change during online play." Usually this denotes that there may/may not be older players and/or adults that play this game too, and that text/voice chat/user-created content isn't regulated on a case-by-case basis. Best one can do without installing mods is to exercise discretion when choosing a server/world to play on, as well as who you play with.

There is an in-game option to mute offending players from both text and voice chat, so you don't have to see/hear their rude remarks. There is also an option to "Only Allow Trusted Skins", which limits visible player skins to what's officially-available in-game, both built-in and from the Marketplace, rather than any custom skins they choose to add to the game via .PNG files.

If someone wants to prevent their children from getting in these interactions, they should teach their children how to avoid it themselves, along with measures like monitoring what server or friends they are playing, and a parental system to enact limits on these. i agree with this suggestion, but i feel not all responsibility should be tossed onto game developers. 

in short, a parent should have access to some measures to keep their child safe, but there is simply now way to keep players from being rude on the internet (were there are virtually no repercussions for their actions) so that your child will be safe.

The best solution would be to hide the chat and to be vigilant about what servers and realms your kids play on. Maybe there can be a "child account" setting where parents can have it so a passcode needs to be input prior to accepting realm invites or joining servers. This way accounts that are "child accounts" don't have access to those features.

 

Also, being Minecraft is owned by Microsoft, they could implement the "parental consent" policy that Xbox Live has in place for accounts that have birthdays indicating the account user is under the age of 18 (not an adult).

I understand where you’re coming from and you want to have a healthy and fun experience for your kid when you two play, but it’s just an unfortunate side effect of any sandbox game. There are quite literally hundreds of communities that utilize this open ended mechanic as an integral part of what they build and how their servers are run, and most servers which do not allow inappropriate conduct already banned it independently. You could play on private servers or stick to ones that you have verified to be safe yourself, but Mojang makes a game that caters to many people and limiting what people can do or say isn’t the direction the game should take.

it is Mojang that made username history public, not 3rd party sites. Anyone can use the official Mojang API in order to get certain info about Java accounts. Some of this info includes the UUID, current username, username history, current skin and current cape (if any) of every player. Sites such as namemc simply make this info much easier to view and will also cache skins and capes, in case the player stops using them (Mojang’s API only allows you to view skins and/or capes of a player if they are currently being used). Contacting these sites to remove such info is thus pointless as they are not the ones making it publicly available.

Anyway, I do believe the current information of every user should stay public, as long as they have the right to get past names of theirs removed (officially, from the Mojang API), even if they’ll have to do that through account support (few people have managed to convince reps to remove names in the past, but the current policies have made that almost impossible nowadays). Although accounts with rare usernames and/or capes do often get targeted as a result of sites like namemc, it is the player’s responsibility to secure their account(s). When it comes to past usernames, however, there is nothing the player can do to remove personally identifiable information and this is where, in my opinion, Mojang needs to step in.
Or an option to hide them.

Mojang should really add this. We should be able to remove any username, not just ones with personal information in it, and it's not very practical to contact Mojang Support just to have a sensitive username removed. It would be much simpler and better to just choose what usernames you want to remove in your account settings. Account username history has been public since the name-change feature was added in 2015. Unfortunately, there are many issues that result from exposing this information to API queries.

In particular, people can use it to trace down account owners (for example, they might do this if somebody want to and purchase an account with a ‘cool’ username, or try and obtain the account through more nefarious means).

Currently only usernames that meet certain criteria can be removed via support requests. They define personally-identifiable information as full names or addresses.

However:

  • the criteria is insufficient: the previous username could have been somebody’s online alias, not specific to Minecraft, and used to sign up to other services in the past. This is especially the case for children/teens who don’t necessarily take many online precautions. The username can be cross-referenced with previous data breaches; some databases explicitly provide a ‘username search’ feature (It's been used on me).
  • Support are uncompromising: even if presented with evidence someone is being contacted, they only remove it if it falls within their rigid guidelines.
  • It is often extremely difficult to get through to Support, even for valid requests.

    It could be obscured by default, with an option to toggle on. Otherwise it will continue to affect the privacy of the player base (largely consisting of children). People have been called up, harassed and hacked in the past following unsuccessful Support appeals.

Well I may be in the minority on this one, but as a Server Owner I use the old names list to make my server safer.  We are whitelisted and take members by application only. We have had some Toxic Players in the past and they were banned, some them have tried to get re-whitelisted by changing their user names. If we no longer have access to the information of old names they could slip through and be re-whitelisted and start doing what they did to get banned in the first place. We do not ban at a whim,  but we do for Racial or prejudicial slurs, griefing , stealing and other inappropriate behavior. We were using the names to actually protect our player base.

Maybe the price of Minecraft is a bit high for what it's worth (which I genuinely don't think, especially since you can buy BE cheaper, but maybe my vision is skewed), but let me teach you some business.

Step 1. Notch starts developing Minecraft as a passion project.

Step 2. He starts charging people for it once it gets popular in order to be able to invest 100% of his time towards development.

...

Step n. Minecraft is developed by two teams: one for Java edition, one for Bedrock.

Step n+1. They keep adding new features. Why? Because

Step n+2. New players might come, excited about new features.

 

The only way Minecraft would be made free would be to stop developing it. Which no business would do, as you may notice most games remain outside the free to play shelf long after developers stop giving any attention towards developing it. Let's be happy Minecraft keeps getting new features and not demand developers' hard work for free.

Since it took me ages to figure this out without requiring shady sites, I will post it here how to play Minecraft on your Chromebook:

- First buy minecraft on the google Play Store 

- Install it on an android phone were it still works

- Backup your app as an APK file (choose your poison: https://android.stackexchange.com/questions/75360/is-it-possible-to-backup-apk-from-an-installed-application )

- Enable Android Apps on Chromebook: https://support.google.com/chromebook/answer/7021273?hl=en

- Now open the google "Play Store" and log in with the same account you bought minecraft on the app store

- Copy minecraft.apk File to your Chromebook

- Just double-click on the apk file, let it install, then open it! Tada

Ps.: you can sync your worlds via google drive sync between your devices

This is an even bigger problem for people with whose Chromebooks are managed through Family Link. Family Link doesn't allow sideloading of Android apps (even though it works on Android devices).

There is a tremendous influx of kids using chromebooks for school at home now, and many (like mine) are using Google's Family Link.  Unfortunately, while regular chromebook users can often just install and run the Linux version of Minecraft via the chromebook's experimental Linux support, child accounts managed by Family Link have this capability disabled. They can, however, still install approved Android apps.  However, the Minecraft Android app isn't available in the Play store for Chromebooks.  

Allowing the existing Linux app to be published to Chromebooks would unlock a lot potential new Minecraft users, and make existing ones very happy as well.  Now is the best possible time to bring Minecraft support to Chromebooks!

By the way, you can't just have "free servers" since they require power, dedicated computers, and in general, they require money. And since money doesn't grow on trees, you have to pay for a server. period.

Damn, right. A seen on this thread: https://hypixel.net/threads/why-do-we-need-transfer-packets.1390307/

though this may already exist, there isn't enough awareness spread around concerning the issue on this subject. weather or not this exists is completely irrelevant and besides the point. it's evident this issue doesn't affect you.

There isn't a transfer packet right now: what actually happens is that a proxy reroutes your Minecraft traffic between servers and tricks your client into thinking it's just changing dimensions. A transfer packet would tell you "connect to this server," instead of saying "hey, I'm this server. Always been this server. Totally."
